string_data:
PRIMARY: Three Just Stop Oil activists threw soup over two Van Gogh Sunflowers paintings at the National Gallery's "Poets and Lovers" exhibition. The protesters demanded an end to new oil and gas projects, calling imprisoned activists "prisoners of conscience." All three were arrested and the paintings remained unharmed.

SECONDARY: This action occurred hours after two other Just Stop Oil members, Phoebe Plummer (23) and Anna Holland (22), were jailed for previously damaging a Van Gogh Sunflowers frame with tomato soup in 2022, causing Â£10,000 damage.

OTHER FOCAL: The article focuses on the pattern of Just Stop Oil targeting Van Gogh artworks and the legal consequences protesters face.

TONE: The article maintains a neutral reporting tone while noting onlookers were "horrified" and describing the actions as "vandalising."
